metadata.title: CVE-2021-29960 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Firefox used to cache the last filename used for printing a file. Whengenerating a filename for printing, Firefox usually suggests the web pagetitle. The caching and suggestion techniques combined may have lead to thetitle of a website visited during private browsing mode being stored ondisk. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 89.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29960` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 89.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 89.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 89.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '89.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
